intro: Thlaspi dinaricum, commonly known as the Dinaric cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and small, alternate leaves along the stem. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
